text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Privatisation of air and sea transport sectors delayed by imprecision in existing laws over government control.
- Troops kill more than 20 Moslem guerrillas in Sidi Ali Bounab forest in the northeastern province of Tizi-Ouzou.
- Five political parties send letter to President Liamine Zeroual seeking a limited government role in supervising the parliamentary elections on June 5.
- Former ruling National Liberation Front party accuses the authorities of backing the National Democratic Rally led by government supporters.
- European Union officials visit Algiers to hold talks with government officials ahead of Malta conference on cooperation between the European Union and southern Mediterranean countries.
